intro: Erigeron heterotrichus, commonly known as the slender blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Erigeron heterotrichus is often found in regions with low precipitation and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
